pullRequest.title: spacewalk-utils: RHEL8 changes. Python changes for pylint.
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR change?

Updated Python files to pass the pylint check.
Updated SPEC file for RHEL8.

GUI diff
No difference.

 DONE

Documentation


No documentation needed: No functional change.


 DONE


Test coverage

No tests: Spec file is tested during auto build.
Not sure if python tests are necessary. Please advice if tests should be created (and how...)

Build tested sucessful on CentOS 8 and LEAP 15.2

 DONE

Links
Fixes #
Tracks # add downstream PR, if any

 DONE

Changelogs
If you don't need a changelog check, please mark this checkbox:

 No changelog needed

If you uncheck the checkbox after the PR is created, you will need to re-run changelog_test (see below)
Re-run a test
If you need to re-run a test, please mark the related checkbox, it will be unchecked automatically once it has re-run:

 Re-run test "changelog_test"

nodes.bodyText:
I think this is not correct. Apparently what you want would be:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    inputfn = input()
          
          
            
                    response = inputfn(txt)
          
          
            
                    while ['y', 'n'].count(response.lower()) == 0:
          
          
            
                        response = inputfn(txt)
          
          
            
                    inputfn = input
          
          
            
                    response = inputfn(txt)
          
          
            
                    while ['y', 'n'].count(response.lower()) == 0:
          
          
            
                        response = inputfn(txt)
          
      
    
    
  

But, since you're dropping the Python 2 compatibility, then it does not make sense anymore to have an inputfn alias. Therefore I think we should go like:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    inputfn = input()
          
          
            
                    response = inputfn(txt)
          
          
            
                    while ['y', 'n'].count(response.lower()) == 0:
          
          
            
                        response = inputfn(txt)
          
          
            
                    response = input(txt)
          
          
            
                    while ['y', 'n'].count(response.lower()) == 0:
          
          
            
                        response = input(txt)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -57,10 +55,7 @@
 
 def confirm(txt, options):
     if not options.assumeyes:
-        if six.PY2:
-            inputfn = raw_input
-        else:
-            inputfn = input
+        inputfn = input()
         response = inputfn(txt)
         while ['y', 'n'].count(response.lower()) == 0:
             response = inputfn(txt)
